Body: I am attempting to flash a modified Android build to my Nexus 7 tablet.I am following this tutorial from Google, and using the specific build commands found here for my device, full_grouper-userdebug.With the device in fastboot mode and connected to the PC, I run the following commands:$ . build/envsetup.sh (Initialize build environment.)$ lunch full_grouper-userdebug (Configure the build for specific device.)$ make -j8 (Build the source.)$ make fastboot adb (Build fastboot and adb.)$ fastboot -w flashall (Flash build to device.)At this point, I receive the following error:error: cannot open '~//out/target/product/grouper/system.img'When I issue a find command, nothing is returned:$ find ~// -name system.img$Why does the file not exist? Without it, I do not know how to flash my modifications. Any ideas?I am using Ubuntu 13.10.
Title: system.img file is missing after building Android source

history.Text: I am attempting to flash a modified Android build to my Nexus 7 tablet.I am following [this tutorial](http://source.android.com/source/building-running.html) from Google, and using the specific build commands [found here](http://source.android.com/source/building-devices.html) for my device, `full_grouper-userdebug`.With the device in fastboot mode and connected to the PC, I run the following commands:`$ . build/envsetup.sh` (Initialize build environment.)`$ lunch full_grouper-userdebug` (Configure the build for specific device.)`$ make -j8` (Build the source.)`$ make fastboot adb` (Build fastboot and adb.)`$ fastboot -w flashall` (Flash build to device.)At this point, I receive the following error:`error: cannot open '~//out/target/product/grouper/system.img'`When I issue a find command, nothing is returned:`$ find ~// -name system.img``$`Why does the file not exist? Without it, I do not know how to flash my modifications. Any ideas?I am using Ubuntu 13.10.
system.img file is missing after building Android source
